title.narrative: Emergency Nutrition, Water and SanitationInterventions and Emergency Mine Risk Education

description.narrative:
• Mass reduction of diarrhea in targeted families Indicators: • % of households correctly/effectively treating drinking water; • % of households correctly storing treated drinking water • % of households consistently treating drinking water
• Awareness levels of the targeted war-affected communities: IDPs, re-settled communities, vulnerable children and women on effects of Mine/ERW being raised. • Mine Risk Educational materials enhanced and promoted to pass on effective MRE messages • Accidents of Mine/ERW in the IDPs, re-settled and other war-affected communities reduced • Livelihoods of targeted war-affected communities improved • Disseminate the findings from the Injury Surveillance System evaluation to create awareness, and mobilize support from stakeholders.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Emergency Nutrition, Water and SanitationInterventions and Emergency Mine Risk Education

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
